name: Button
description: A foundational, accessible Button component with semantic variants, sizes, icon-only support, loading/disabled states, and optional link/toggle behavior. Designed to map cleanly into existing design systems via tokens and adapter rules.

aiAgentInstructions.summary: Implement a reusable Button component that is accessible by default, supports semantic variants (primary/secondary/ghost/destructive/link), sizes (sm/md/lg), icon-only buttons, loading state (prevents double submit), and optional link/toggle behavior. CRITICAL: integrate into the existing design system (tokens, class conventions, existing Button primitives) rather than inventing new styling.
keyFeatures: Default semantic <button> with type control (button/submit/reset) and safe defaults
Variants: primary, secondary, ghost, destructive, link (map to existing DS equivalents)
Sizes: sm, md, lg with consistent heights and padding
Icon + label layout with stable spacing; icon-only supported
Loading state: disables interactions, announces busy state, prevents double submit
Disabled state: true disabled behavior for <button>; aria-disabled strategy for link variant
Focus-visible ring that matches project conventions (never remove focus indicator)
Cursor: pointer by default for clickable affordance; cursor: not-allowed when disabled
Optional toggle behavior via aria-pressed (when togglable=true)
CRITICAL: Styling MUST match the project's existing conventions. Detect framework + styling system first, then use ONLY that system.
CRITICAL: When detecting vanilla CSS/SCSS, ALWAYS create CSS classes in a stylesheet. NEVER use inline style attributes.
implementationSteps: 0. MANDATORY - Detect before implementing: From package.json and source files (e.g. existing components, main CSS/SCSS), determine the project's framework and styling system. Use ONLY the matching stylingApproaches entry (e.g. tailwindCSS, cssModules, scss, styledComponents). Do not choose or mix another approach; if the project uses Tailwind, do not add a separate stylesheet; if it uses CSS Modules, do not use Tailwind utilities.
0a. If the project already has a Button primitive: wrap/extend it to add missing behaviors (loading, icon-only a11y, aria-pressed) without breaking existing usage.
0b. If tokens exist (CSS vars, Tailwind theme, theme files): map variant+state styles to those tokens. Avoid hardcoded colors.
1. Build component anatomy: Root, Label, LeadingIcon, TrailingIcon, Spinner, FocusRing (style), LoadingOverlay (optional).
2. Implement props: variant, size, disabled, loading, iconOnly, fullWidth, type, as (button|a), href, togglable, pressed.
3. Enforce behavior rules: loading implies disabled interaction; submit buttons must not double-submit; keep layout stable during loading (spinner + label).
4. Implement focus-visible ring following project patterns; ensure keyboard support is native and intact.
5. Add accessibility: correct semantics, aria-busy for loading, aria-disabled for anchors, aria-label for icon-only, aria-pressed for toggles.
6. Add reduced-motion support: shorten/disable press transforms; keep focus ring and color transitions minimal.
8. Validate with testingChecklist (keyboard, SR, disabled/link behavior, loading).

componentSpec.goal: Provide a single, design-system-friendly Button component that can be used across the product for actions and navigation while remaining accessible, consistent, and easy for agents to integrate into existing styling/token systems.

variant.description: Semantic style variant mapped to the project's design system.

size.description: Size variant affecting height, padding, and font size.

disabled.description: Disables interactions and indicates non-interactive state.

loading.description: Shows spinner, prevents interactions, and indicates busy state.

focused.description: Whether the button currently has focus (for styling only).

pressedVisual.description: Visual pressed state for pointer down (not aria-pressed unless togglable).

togglable.description: If true, button represents a toggle; use aria-pressed with pressed state.

pressed.description: Toggle state when togglable=true (controlled or uncontrolled).

iconOnly.description: Icon-only mode: label is visually hidden; aria-label is required.

fullWidth.description: Expands button to full container width.

as.description: Render target: native button or anchor (link button). Prefer <button> for actions.

sideEffects: If togglable=true: toggle pressed state and set aria-pressed accordingly
If as='a': navigate to href (unless aria-disabled=true)
Enter/Space activate the button (native behavior for <button>)
If as='a': Enter activates link; Space should not scroll the page (optional: preventDefault + trigger click for link-style buttons)
interactions.accessibilityNotes: Prefer native semantics. Only intercept Space for anchor-as-button scenarios if needed.

mobile.behavior: Ensure min touch target of 44px; prefer md size by default; fullWidth is common in forms.
mobile.typography: Keep label font size >= 16px where it prevents iOS zoom in form-heavy contexts (project dependent).

desktop.behavior: Enable hover states; keep press animation subtle; avoid layout shift on loading.
desktop.hover: Variant-specific hover feedback (color/brightness) aligned to DS.

primary.behavior: Use primary action tokens; strong contrast; supports loading.

secondary.behavior: Neutral surface with border or subtle fill.

destructive.behavior: Use danger tokens; ensure contrast; optionally require confirmation elsewhere.

link.description: Text-like button for inline actions or navigation.
link.behavior: Prefer <a> for true navigation; underline on hover/focus; aria-disabled strategy when disabled.

toggle.requirements: Use aria-pressed and maintain visible on/off styling.

ariaLabel.description: Required when iconOnly=true and no visible label.

events.onClick: Fired on activation (mouse/keyboard). Not fired when disabled/loading.
events.onPressedChange: Fired when togglable=true and pressed state changes.

press.transform: Optional subtle scale (1 -> 0.98) OR brightness change; keep minimal to avoid jank
press.notes: Prefer no transform if DS avoids it; never cause layout shift.

properties.focusRing: Fade/transition focus ring to visible state

loading.notes: Spinner should not change button width; reserve space or overlay while preserving label width.

reducedMotion.behavior: Disable press transforms; use simple opacity/color transitions with short durations
reducedMotion.implementation: @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) { /* reduce/disable transforms and long transitions */ }

requirements.1.3.1: Use native semantics (<button> for actions, <a> for navigation) so role/name are correct.
requirements.1.4.3: Text/icon contrast must meet WCAG AA (4.5:1 for text; 3:1 for large text/icons depending on context).
requirements.2.1.1: Keyboard operable via native activation (Enter/Space for buttons).
requirements.3.2.2: Activation should not cause unexpected context changes without user intent.
requirements.4.1.2: Accessible name, role, state: disabled, pressed (aria-pressed), busy (aria-busy).

keyboardNavigation.Tab: Moves focus to the button/link if focusable.
keyboardNavigation.Enter: Activates button; activates link when as='a'.
keyboardNavigation.Space: Activates native <button>. For <a>, Space should not scroll; optional: preventDefault + trigger click if used as button-like control.

button.disabled: Use native disabled attribute when as='button'.

iconOnly.aria-label: Required when iconOnly=true and label is not visible.

linkDisabled.aria-disabled: Use aria-disabled='true' for as='a' disabled behavior; also remove from tab order (tabIndex=-1) and prevent click.

screenReader.nameComputation: Icon-only buttons must provide aria-label; visible label preferred otherwise.
screenReader.loading: When loading=true, announce busy state via aria-busy and/or include visually hidden 'Loading' text if appropriate.
screenReader.toggle: When togglable=true, screen reader announces pressed state via aria-pressed.

focusManagement.focusRing: Use :focus-visible (or framework equivalent) to avoid showing focus on mouse click while preserving keyboard focus indication.
focusManagement.neverRemoveFocus: Never remove focus outline without replacement.
focusManagement.disabledFocus: Disabled buttons should not be focusable. For aria-disabled links: remove from tab order.

implementationChecklist: Use <button> for actions, <a> for navigation when possible.
Default type='button' to avoid accidental form submits.
Native disabled attribute for <button> when disabled=true OR loading=true.
If as='a' and disabled: set aria-disabled='true', prevent navigation, set tabIndex=-1.
Toggle mode uses aria-pressed and visible pressed styling.
Focus-visible ring is present and matches DS conventions.
Loading state prevents double-submit and does not cause layout shift.

framework.description: Identify the UI framework and component conventions (including existing Button primitives).
detectionSteps: Inspect package.json for framework (React/Vue/Angular/Svelte) and UI libraries (MUI/Chakra/AntD/shadcn/etc.).
Search the codebase for an existing Button component and how variants/sizes are implemented.
Check routing/link primitives (Next.js Link, react-router Link, Vue Router) to decide how link buttons should render.

stylingSystem.description: Detect the styling approach and match it exactly.
detectionSteps: Check for tailwindcss, sass, CSS Modules, styled-components/emotion, vanilla-extract.
Inspect existing components to see class composition patterns (cn/clsx/classnames).
Locate design tokens (CSS vars, theme objects, Tailwind theme).
adaptationRules: If a design system Button exists: extend/wrap; do not re-invent styles.
If Tailwind: implement with utility classes and existing token conventions; avoid new global CSS.
If CSS Modules/SCSS: implement BEM-like state modifiers; no inline styles.
If styled-components/emotion: use theme tokens and props; do not introduce class stylesheets.

designTokens.description: Map semantic variants and states to existing token sets.
detectionSteps: Find action/brand tokens for primary, neutral tokens for secondary/ghost, danger tokens for destructive.
Find focus ring conventions (outline, box-shadow, ring tokens).
Confirm disabled and loading state patterns used elsewhere.

must: Match existing framework patterns and any existing Button primitive.
Match existing styling conventions exactly (Tailwind/CSS Modules/SCSS/styled-components/etc.).
Prevent interactions when loading=true (no double submit).
Provide focus-visible ring and do not remove focus indication.
Use semantic variants and map them to DS tokens (avoid hardcoded colors).
mustNot: Do not introduce a new styling system or CSS strategy.
Do not hardcode brand colors if a token system exists.
Do not use <div role='button'> unless absolutely unavoidable (prefer native).
Do not ship icon-only buttons without an accessible name.
Do not allow loading buttons to be activated multiple times.

In TypeScript: do not spread a loosely-typed object containing ARIA attributes (e.g. Record<string, string | boolean>) onto <button> or <a>; use correctly typed props (Booleanish for aria-busy, aria-pressed, aria-disabled) to avoid DOM attribute type errors.

testingChecklist: Renders as <button> by default and is focusable via Tab.
Default type is 'button' (no accidental form submit).
Submit type triggers form submit when type='submit'.
Disabled <button> cannot be focused or clicked.
Loading=true prevents clicks and key activation; no double submit.
Loading does not cause layout shift (width stable).
Icon-only requires aria-label; screen reader announces name.
Focus-visible ring appears with keyboard navigation and meets contrast requirements.
Hover state appears on desktop pointer devices; not required on touch-only.
Link variant renders as <a> when appropriate; disabled link uses aria-disabled + tabIndex=-1 and blocks navigation.
Toggle mode sets aria-pressed correctly and updates on activation.
Reduced motion disables press transforms (if implemented) and keeps interaction usable.

react.stateManagement: Prefer a stateless Button; togglable can be controlled via pressed/onPressedChange or internal state when defaultPressed provided.
react.typeScript: When passing ARIA props (aria-busy, aria-pressed, aria-disabled) to <button> or <a>, use types React expects: boolean or Booleanish, not string | boolean. Avoid building these in a loosely-typed Record (e.g. Record<string, string | boolean | undefined>) and spreading onto the element, or TypeScript will report incompatible DOM attribute types. Use conditional spreads with literal types (e.g. ...(loading && { 'aria-busy': true })) or explicitly typed props instead.

vue.stateManagement: Use props for variant/size/disabled/loading; emit click and pressed-change for toggle mode.

angular.stateManagement: Use @Input for props; @Output for click/pressedChange; ensure type defaulting to 'button' in templates.

svelte.stateManagement: Use exported props; dispatch events; maintain minimal internal state only for uncontrolled toggle mode.

tailwindCSS.rootBase: inline-flex items-center justify-center rounded-md font-semibold cursor-pointer transition focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:opacity-50 disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:cursor-not-allowed
tailwindCSS.notes: Map these to the project's actual Tailwind tokens/classes; do not assume color names exist.

stylingApproaches.styledComponents: Create a styled ButtonRoot that reads variant/size props and theme tokens; keep :focus-visible styling consistent with DS.

primaryCTA.description: Primary button used for the main action on a page.
primaryCTA.notes: Ensure strong contrast and clear focus ring.

linkButton.description: Button styled like a link for inline actions or navigation.
linkButton.requirements: Use <a> for navigation; manage disabled via aria-disabled.

destructiveConfirm.description: Destructive action button used alongside confirmation flows.

iconOnlyNoLabel.issue: Icon-only button has no accessible name.

disabledAnchor.solution: Use aria-disabled, tabIndex=-1, and prevent default navigation/click.

loadingDoubleClick.issue: Users can trigger action multiple times.
loadingDoubleClick.solution: When loading=true, block activation and show busy state.

layoutShiftOnSpinner.solution: Reserve space for label and/or overlay spinner without changing width.

relatedPotions.description: Buttons are used in dialog action footers (primary/secondary/destructive).
Buttons commonly appear with form inputs (submit, clear, next-step).
